intro: Caiophora sylvestris var. leptocarpa, commonly known as the slender-leaf caiophora, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rhamnaceae. It is characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves and small, clustered white flowers. Native to the temperate regions of the northern hemisphere, this plant thrives in woodland and shrubland habitats. The plant produces small, oval berries that are typically dark red or black when mature. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits, providing food for various bird species.
